title: Accelerate datanode recovery
body:
## Description

This PR is optimizing two points.

1. #5800 added a strategy. When execute stop scripts, the data in memory will flush to disk. However, this strategy was skipped.
2. Compaction threads may take too much CPU resource, which caused recovery being slow. We can start compaction after all data region recovered.

Release notes

Sourced from google.golang.org/grpc's releases.

Security

title: Support batch processing in UDF interface
body:
## Description
In this pr, we add a new batch processing UDF interface for scalar functions to avoid too much function calls and Java boxing/unboxing costs.
```java
void transform(Column[] columns, ColumnBuilder builder);
```
This modification has been observed to have huge performance benefit compared to old ones, which saves the end-to-end query time accordingly. More details can be seen in  https://lz8h91usu0.feishu.cn/docx/OA9tdC8wXow1b0xu6kOcPZFqnMg

Now IoTDB only calls the batch interface internally when dealing with scalar functions. For those User Defined Functions which only implement single row method, IoTDB can still handle them correctly by calling them row by row in new method's default implementation.

While this new method use tsfile module members like `Column` and `ColumnBuilder`, and introducing such a large dependency is unacceptable for users, for the packaging time will dramatically increases, we extract a `common-api` module to expose minimum required members from tsfile. And it will be shared by other modules in the future.


<hr>

This PR has:
- [x] been self-reviewed.
- [x] added Javadocs for most classes and all non-trivial methods.

title: Pipe: support parameter extractor.history.sloppy-time-range to improve historical data processing efficiency
body:
## Usage Scenario

When exporting historical data, there is often a need to export data for a specific time period.
There are two ways to export historical data: directly exporting files or parsing files and assembling write requests to send to the destination.
To strictly export historical data within a given time range, the latter method is used, which involves splitting and parsing files, resulting in lower efficiency.
If you want to export a larger amount of data to ensure that all data is exported in file format and shorten the export time, you can use the "loose-range" parameter provided in iotdb-extractor.

## Usage

When creating a pipe, you can trigger the "loose-range" parameter by providing it in iotdb-extractor. The example is as follows:

```sql
create pipe example
with extractor (
  'extractor'                    = 'iotdb-extractor',
  'extractor.history.enable'     = 'true',
  'extractor.history.start-time' = '2011.12.03T10:15:30+01:00',
  'extractor.history.end-time'   = '2022.12.03T10:15:30+01:00',
  'extractor.loose-range'        = 'time', 
)
with connector (
  'connector'                    = 'iotdb-thrift-connector',
  'connector.ip'                 = '127.0.0.1',
  'connector.port'               = '6667',
)
```

------

## 使用场景

当进行历史数据导出的时候，往往有导出部分时间段历史数据的需求。
导出历史数据，有两种方式，一种是直接导出文件，一种是解析文件并组装写入请求发送到目标端。
严格按照给定的时间范围导出历史数据，采用的是后一种导出方式，涉及到对文件进行切分解析，效率不高。
如果你希望导出更多的数据量，以保证所有的数据按照文件的方式导出，从而换取更短的导出时间的话，你可以用 iotdb-extractor 里面提供参数 "loose-range" 参数。

## 使用方法

创建 pipe 的时候，可以在 iotdb-extractor 里面提供参数 "loose-range" 参数即可触发, 例子如下：

```sql
create pipe example
with extractor (
  'extractor'                    = 'iotdb-extractor',
  'extractor.history.enable'     = 'true',
  'extractor.history.start-time' = '2011.12.03T10:15:30+01:00',
  'extractor.history.end-time'   = '2022.12.03T10:15:30+01:00',
  'extractor.loose-range'        = 'time', 
)
with connector (
  'connector'                    = 'iotdb-thrift-connector',
  'connector.ip'                 = '127.0.0.1',
  'connector.port'               = '6667',
)
```

title: Avoid modification causing OOM while there is much deletion entry in mods file
body:
More details can be seen in https://jira.infra.timecho.com:8443/browse/TIMECHODB-349.

In this pr:
1. For loading from disk case, we delete `filePathModCache` in `QueryContext`,  save List<Modification> in `IChunkMetadataLoader`.
2. for loading from memory, we generating `TimeSeriesMetadata` from each `ChunkMetadata`, so we can directly use isModified function of `ChunkMetadata` to set modified of `TimeSeriesMetadata`.


In this way, we can safely delete `filePathModCache` without sacrificing query performance.

title: feat(env):add MEMORY_SIZE parameters into env.sh/env.bat
body:
1. add MEMORY_SIZE
2. MAX_HEAP_SIZE and HEAP_NEWSIZE -> ON_HEAP_MEMORY
3. DIRECT_MEMORY_SIZE -> OFF_HEAP_MEMORY
4. add calc MEMORY_SIZE
    - ConfigNode  MEMORY_SIZE default is 3 / 10 on system memory, max size is 16G
    - DataNode  MEMORY_SIZE default is 1 / 2 on system memory

5. change heap memory size rule
    - set on heap memory size
    - when memory_size_in_mb is less than 4 * 1024, we will set on heap memory size to memory_size_in_mb / 4 * 3
    - when memory_size_in_mb is greater than 4 * 1024 and less than 16 * 1024, we will set on heap memory size to memory_size_in_mb / 5 * 4
    - when memory_size_in_mb is greater than 16 * 1024 and less than 128 * 1024, we will set on heap memory size to memory_size_in_mb / 8 * 7
    - when memory_size_in_mb is greater than 128 * 1024, we will set on heap memory size to memory_size_in_mb - 16 * 1024

16GB bat(windows)

title: [IOTDB-6207] Load: Add Write Point Rate Metric
body:
## Description

The metirc is used to record the write point rate when loading tsfile.
In order to minimize the impact on load performance, during the load analysis phase, we can get all chunkmetadatas in the index area of the tsfile, which holds the data point count of  the chunk, and we store the counts into the corresponding ChunkData for metric counter.
After every time LoadScheduler  calls `dispatchOnePieceNode`, we add the data point count in PieceNode into metric framework.

-------------------
该metric 用于记录load tsfile的写入速率。
为了尽可能不影响load 性能，在load 解析文件阶段，我们可以在该tsfile的索引区获取所有chunkmetadata信息，metadata其中记录了chunk的总数据点数，我们将其存储到 ChunkData 中，以便后续每次 load 分发一个piece node后，将该node的数据总点数上报给监控框架。

The previous opc-ua-connector key directory setting "java.io.tmpdir" is not capable of keeping certificates in a long run, thus the key directory is now configurable and resides in "%IOTDB-CONF%/opc-security" directory by default.

title: Improve the high availability of IoTDB
body: For 3C3D 2 replicas or 3 replicas dataregion, if we kill one datanode, client should keep inserting data successfully without any error. However, currently, there is no retry logic in dispatch for write, so if the leader of one DataRegionGroup is down, the dispatch phase will fail and will return a 302 status code to Session, and meet this kind of StatusCode, Session won't retry this write request, it will throw this exception to the upper layer. You will get the error msg like the following: more details about this improvement can be found in this feishu doc(https://timechor.feishu.cn/docx/WuVJdNpGOowEGIxvaOlcwt9mngg) In this pr, we add retry logic in `AsyncPlanNodeSender` which will try other replica to do the write dispatch. I also simplify the error msg while connection is down, only print the root cause class name and its msg instead of the full call stack.

title: auth.add entry for pre version plan.
body:
```bash
#!/bin/bash

iotdb_source_path="/Users/oushu/dev/iotdb"
iotdb_install_path="/tmp/iotdb"
iotdb_branch="rel/1.2"
iotdb_current_branch="sl_fix_upgrade_1.2"

echo "iotdb source path : $iotdb_source_path"
echo "iotdb install path : $iotdb_install_path"
echo "iotdb source branch : $iotdb_branch"

echo "----- check source path git status"
cd  "$iotdb_source_path"
output=$(git status  --porcelain)
if [ -n "$output" ]; then
    echo "error, you have unsaved git files."
    exit 1
fi
echo " git status ok"

echo "----- complie pre version iotdb"
git checkout "$iotdb_branch"
mvn clean package -pl distribution  -am -DskipTests  -T 20 > complie_pre.txt

echo "----- install into $iotdb_install_path"
cp -rf distribution/target/apache-iotdb-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-all-bin/apache-iotdb-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-all-bin "$iotdb_install_path"

echo "----- start pre version iotdb"
cd ${iotdb_install_path}/sbin
sh start-standalone.sh
echo "----- iotdb standalone started."

echo "----- generate sql to execute"
# go to the dir of gen.py
```

title: fix(cli-it): add IOTDB_HOME into environment
Add Interface to extend TsFileResource
body:
## Description

Currently, TsFileResource serializes the PROGRESS INDEX information to TsFileResource files. When serializes the PROGRESS INDEX information, firstly write a byte 1 or 0 to represent whether contains the progress index, then write the content.

Now, we can extend the usage of the PROGRESS INDEX to store more information. We can introduce the  TsFileResourceBlockType to represent the block type of TsFileResource File and use more types bytes 2,3... to record the extended file block.

## Design
https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/VIpmddFQFoa3yKxX9MhcvZ6cnXg

title: Fix aligned timeseries may loss point after flush
body:
## Description

https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/F7GCdbkmXoCHdkxtGDqchV9TnZe


## How to reproduce

Set `max_number_of_points_in_page=2`, then execute the following sql, you will see some data points missed after flushed.
```
create aligned timeseries root.sg.d1(s1 float, s2 float,s3 float)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(3,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(1,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s1) values(2,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s2) values(2,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s2) values(1,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s2) values(3,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s3) values(1,1)
insert into root.sg.d1(time,s3) values(2,1)
select count(*) from root.**
flush
select count(*) from root.**
```

![926d739c-8e61-4eab-b445-ef026627f94e](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/assets/25913899/50c58485-af28-4f24-b19b-e570f879872a)

title: Add SLEEP_BOUND for the DriverTaskTimeoutSentinelThread
body:
Before this PR, if the ddl of a DriverTask selected by the SentinelThread is very long(e.g. Integer.MAX_VALUE), the SentinelThread will sleep forever and the timeout mechanism for the query will become ineffective.
In this PR, I add a SLEEP_BOUND for the SentinelThread to ensure that it won't sleep for too long. SLEEP_BOUND is just an empirical value rather than a calculated one.
We re-push the task into the timeout queue within the lock, so the status of the task will not be changed until we finish the re-push. If the task is finished after we re-push it into the timeout queue, the task will be removed from the timeout queue either in the process of finishing/aborting a DriverTask, or when it is selected by the SentinelThread again.

title: [IOTDB-6198] Pipe: Memory Management Framework
body:
## Description
Pipe module memory is divided into two main sections: Static Memory and Dynamic Memory.
* static memory: the lifecycle is bending to a specific pipe.
* dynamic memory: related to Pipe framework or user's custom logic operation.

So if we want to manage pipe memory, we have to build a framework which implements the allocation and release of memory within the Pipe module.
The framework provides `allocate()` & `release` methods.

title: Pipe: decouple pipe receiver dir from DN system dir and add support for multiple receiver dirs
body:
## Description

As title.

When `pipe_receiver_file_dirs` is not configured, the pipe receiver directory still defaults to follow the `dn_system_dir`. When `pipe_receiver_file_dirs` is configured, for example:

```properties
pipe_receiver_file_dirs=data/datanode/receiver1,data/datanode/receiver2
```

In this case, the pipe receiver directory will be as follows:

![image](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/assets/79143929/77d2cf38-8810-42da-9d9f-a720ba8cd937)

**NOTE:** In https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/11318 and THIS PR, it is assumed that `systemDir` will be initialized with the user-specified value **before** the call to `getPipeReceiverFileDir(s)`.

title: Fix/fix grafana plugin build
body:
## Description

There were issues with the grafana sdk which seems to have referenced a library in "latest" version. Unfortunately that library got a new major version which was API incompatible with the old, so the build broke. Explicitly pulling in the last working version resolved the problem.

This PR also updates the Netty version to a version that has resolved the CVEs that we had been getting reports for, but weren't able to fix.

title: Bump org.springframework:spring-web from 5.3.30 to 6.0.0
body:
Bumps [org.springframework:spring-web](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework) from 5.3.30 to 6.0.0.
Release notes

Sourced from org.springframework:spring-web's releases.

v6.0.0

See What's New in Spring Framework 6.x and Upgrading to Spring Framework 6.x for upgrade instructions and details of new features.

:star: New Features

  • Avoid direct URL construction and URL equality checks #29486
  • Simplify creating RFC 7807 responses from functional endpoints #29462
  • Allow test classes to provide runtime hints via declarative mechanisms #29455

:notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

  • Align javadoc of DefaultParameterNameDiscoverer with its behavior #29494
  • Document AOT support in the TestContext framework #29482
  • Document Ahead of Time processing in the reference guide #29350

:hammer: Dependency Upgrades

  • Upgrade to Reactor 2022.0.0 #29465

:heart: Contributors

Thank you to all the contributors who worked on this release:

@​ophiuhus and @​wilkinsona

v6.0.0-RC4

:star: New Features

  • Introduce DataFieldMaxValueIncrementer for SQL Server sequences #29447
  • Introduce findAllAnnotationsOnBean variant on ListableBeanFactory #29446
  • Introduce support for Jakarta WebSocket 2.1 #29436
  • Allow @ControllerAdvice in WebFlux to handle exceptions before a handler is selected #22991

:lady_beetle: Bug Fixes

  • Bean with unresolved generics do not use fallback algorithms with AOT #29454
  • TomcatRequestUpgradeStrategy is not compatible with Tomcat 10.1 #29434
  • Autowiring of a generic type produced by a factory bean fails after AOT processing #29385

:notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

  • Reference PDF containing full docs not available #28451

:hammer: Dependency Upgrades

  • Revisit Servlet API baseline: Servlet 6.0 in the build, Servlet 5.0 compatibility at runtime #29435

Release notes

Sourced from go.opentelemetry.io/contrib/instrumentation/net/http/httptrace/otelhttptrace's releases.

Release v1.20.0/v0.45.0/v0.14.0

Added

  • Set the description for the rpc.server.duration metric in go.opentelemetry.io/contrib/instrumentation/google.golang.org/grpc/otelgrpc. (#4302)
  • Add NewServerHandler and NewClientHandler that return a grpc.StatsHandler used for gRPC instrumentation in go.opentelemetry.io/contrib/instrumentation/google.golang.org/grpc/otelgrpc. (#3002)
  • Add new Prometheus bridge module in go.opentelemetry.io/contrib/bridges/prometheus. (#4227)

Changed

  • Upgrade dependencies of OpenTelemetry Go to use the new v1.19.0/v0.42.0/v0.0.7 release.

title: [To rel/1.2] Fix wal recover rel1.2
body: When the datanode restarts, WalManager restores the maximum searchIndex from the wal file. The consensus layer depends on this value. You should wait until searchIndex recovers before releasing the count lock

title: Fixed an issue where searchIndex was not restored properly after IoT protocol restart
body:
## Description

When the datanode restarts, WalManager restores the maximum searchIndex from the wal file. The consensus layer depends on this value. You should wait until searchIndex recovers before releasing the count lock

title: Pipe: integrate pipe with metrics framework & add assigner / extractor / processor / connector / heartbeat metrics
body:
## Description

Capturing metrics for event accumulation and flow rate as well.

**TODO:**

- [x] implement `unbindFrom` for dropping metrics
- [ ] explore the elegant way to invoke `(de)register` method at various stages of pipe execution

---

sync from pipe metrics doc: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/QW6edUm0KoVP7lxPXhycMLvJn7g

### DisruptorQueue

`RealtimeEvent` event accumulation

| Metric                 | Tags          | Level | Type  |
| -------------------------- | ----------------- | --------- | --------- |
| unassigned_tablet_count    | region=`<regionID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| unassigned_tsfile_count   | region=`<regionID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| unassigned_heartbeat_count | region=`<regionID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |

### PipeExtractor

> `<taskID> = <pipeName>_<dataRegionId>_<creationTime>`

`ArrayDeque<TsFileResource> pendingQueue` event accumulation

| Metric                           | Tags      | Level | Type  |
| ------------------------------------ | ------------- | --------- | --------- |
| unprocessed_historical_tsfile_count | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |

`UnboundedBlockingPendingQueue<Event> pendingQueue` event accumulation

| Metric                         | Tags      | Level | Type  |
| ---------------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | --------- |
| unprocessed_tablet_count           | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| unprocessed_realtime_tsfile_count | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| unprocessed_heartbeat_count        | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |

`supply` call rate

| Metric                      | Tags      | Level | Type |
| ------------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | -------- |
| pipe_extractor_tablet_supply    | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_extractor_tsfile_supply   | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_extractor_heartbeat_supply | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |

### PipeProcessor

> `<taskID> = <pipeName>_<dataRegionId>_<creationTime>`

`EnrichedDeque<Event> bufferQueue` event accumulation

| Metric                      | Tags      | Level | Type  |
| ------------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | --------- |
| buffered_tablet_count           | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| buffered_tsfile_count | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| buffered_heartbeat_count        | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |

`process` call rate

| Metric                       | Tags      | Level | Type |
| -------------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | -------- |
| pipe_processor_tablet_process    | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_processor_tsfile_process   | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_processor_heartbeat_process | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |

### PipeConnector

> `<taskID> = <attributeSortedString>_<creationTime>_<index>`

`BoundedBlockingPendingQueue<Event> pendingQueue` event accumulation

| Metric                    | Tags      | Level | Type  |
| ----------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | --------- |
| untransferred_tablet_count    | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| untransferred_tsfile_count   | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |
| untransferred_heartbeat_count | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | AutoGauge |

`transfer` call rate

| Metric                        | Tags      | Level | Type |
| --------------------------------- | ------------- | --------- | -------- |
| pipe_connector_tablet_transfer    | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_connector_tsfile_transfer   | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |
| pipe_connector_heartbeat_transfer | name=`<taskID>` | IMPORTANT | Rate     |

### PipeHeartbeatEvent

| Metric           | Tags                       | Level | Type |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------ | --------- | -------- |
| pipe_heartbeat_event | stage="publishedToAssigned"    | IMPORTANT | Timer    |
| pipe_heartbeat_event | stage="assignedToProcessed"    | IMPORTANT | Timer    |
| pipe_heartbeat_event | stage="processedToTransferred" | IMPORTANT | Timer    |

title: Fix the problem of inaccurate GC monitor detection at the beginning and adjusting the alert threshold.
body: 1. Fix the problem of inaccurate GC monitor detection at the beginning. - When the Metric Service starts after the jvm, the gc time before the Metric Service is started will also be counted, causing the GC percentage within the initial time window to be significantly higher than expected, as shown in this figure: - Fix this bug by only calculating GC time within the time window. The effect after fixing this bug is shown in this figure: 2. Lowered the gc percentage alert threshold from 50% to 30%.

title: [IOTDB-6187] IoTConsense WAL Interval Reading Strategy Optimization
body:
#### Description

IoTConsensus WAL always resets the insertNodes when WAL skip to a new targetIndex. But in most writting process, targetIndex is sequentially increasing, which means we may use the previous insertNodes as a cache and doesn't need to reset it everytime.
